instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message:
The computer has green/orange, charging and everything.
When start loading after 50% shutdown.

<CAPACITOR>C7648</CAPACITOR> - 1.05v (on)
<CAPACITOR>C7649</CAPACITOR> - 1.05v (on)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message: Clean install OSX? Liquid damage? BIOS chip original?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message:
Even if i try use ASD happen the same.
Bios is original
Yes, water damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message: I get that, but which rails you suggest for take a look more close?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message: Unplug keyboard and try again, Duke is not talking about any rail, he said corroded areas.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message:
Yes, i just use without keyboard.
Yes, understand what duke said. But the board don't have any corroded areas.
But if he give any hint for take a look more close (capacitor etc) maybe we can figure out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A - start  after 50% OS loaded shutdown
threads.message: So it was liquid damaged but no corrosion, in that case it should be working fine. How can I tell you where to look for corrosion? The usual suspects apply again <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, diagnostic connector, etc.
